line=8720 tag=M+LN+CN+DB:  (6) Alternating Unaccusative verbs in Spanish                    2 .3    Morphology in lexical argument structure
line=8721 tag=L+DB:  a. El vaso se                 rompió.
line=8722 tag=M+DB:                                                                     Within the framework of Hale and Keyser, these
line=8723 tag=G+DB:      the vase reflexive clitic break-past
line=8724 tag=M+DB:                                                                   cross-linguistic differences result from the
line=8725 tag=T+DB:      "The vase broke."

doc_id=1615 igt_id=igt1615-13 8727 8731 L+DB M+DB G+DB M+DB T+DB
language: Spanish (spa)
line=8727 tag=L+DB:  b. Bill rompió       el vaso.
line=8728 tag=M+DB:                                                                   in the verbal heads. In the case of Spanish, for
line=8729 tag=G+DB:      Bill break-past the vase
line=8730 tag=M+DB:                                                                   instance, the anticausative morphology se occupies
line=8731 tag=T+DB:      "Bill broke the vase"

doc_id=3132 igt_id=igt3132-8 640 658 L B L B L B L B L B T B T B T B T B T+AC
language: Spanish (spa)
line=640 tag=L:  (13)    Un día una viejita estaba sembrando maíz y se encontró un pajarito amarillo.
line=641 tag=B:
line=642 tag=L:          El pajarito estaba enfermo y no podía volar. La viejita lo llevó a su casa, lo abrigó
line=643 tag=B:
line=644 tag=L:          y le dio un remedio. Al otro día el pajarito estaba sano. Entonces la viejita le dio
line=645 tag=B:
line=646 tag=L:          de comer trigo, pan y agua. La viejita le puso de nombre Pío Pío y todos los días
line=647 tag=B:
line=648 tag=L:          el pajarito canta para la viejita.
line=649 tag=B:
line=650 tag=T:          "One day, an old lady was sowing corn and (she) found a little yellow bird. The
line=651 tag=B:
line=652 tag=T:          bird was sick and could not fly.The old lady took it to her house, warmed it and
line=653 tag=B:
line=654 tag=T:          gave it a medicine. The next day the bird was healthy" "Then the old lady fed it
line=655 tag=B:
line=656 tag=T:          wheat, bread and water." "The old lady named it Pio Pio "and the little bird sings
line=657 tag=B:
line=658 tag=T+AC:          everyday for the old lady" Sánchez (2004:154)

doc_id=3132 igt_id=igt3132-9 670 682 L B L B L B T B T B T B M+AC
language: Spanish (spa)
line=670 tag=L:  (14) Había una viejita dice. Había sembrado maíz. Ella sembraba maíz. Le había
line=671 tag=B:
line=672 tag=L:           encontrado un pajarito # amarillo Y le había llevado a su casa. Y le había hecho
line=673 tag=B:
line=674 tag=L:           comer trigo # agua # pan.
line=675 tag=B:
line=676 tag=T:           "(There) was an old woman, (they) say. (S/he) had sowed corn. She sowed corn.
line=677 tag=B:
line=678 tag=T:           (She) found a yellow bird for him/her. And (she) took him home, And (she) made
line=679 tag=B:
line=680 tag=T:           him eat wheat, water and bread."
line=681 tag=B:
line=682 tag=M+AC:           Sánchez (2004: 157-158)

line=460 tag=G:           I suppose(PRS)     that   the boss    come(FUT)    to the meeting
line=461 tag=T+AC:           `I suppose the boss will come to the meeting.' (Kattán-Ibarra & Pountain 1997: 424)

language: Spanish (spa)

line=471 tag=T+DB:           `He will be with his friends (e.g. tomorrow) / he would/must be with his friends (i.e.
line=472 tag=T+AC:           now).' (Matte Bon 1992a: 37)
